meanings.definition: The highest point; the top or apex.
meanings.sent1: The mountain's vertex was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered at the vertex of the pole.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed to the vertex of the tree and couldn't find its way down.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement reached its vertex when she won the competition.
meanings.sent5: The vertex of the pyramid gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A point where two or more lines meet to form an angle.
meanings.sent1: The vertex of the angle was clearly marked on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The roof's vertex was where the two walls met.
meanings.sent3: The spider spun its web from one vertex to another.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the vertex where their interests intersected.
meanings.sent5: The vertex of the triangle was at a perfect 90-degree angle.

meanings.definition: The point on a geometric figure where two or more sides meet.
meanings.sent1: The vertex of the square was at the corner.
meanings.sent2: The vertex of the polygon determined its shape.
meanings.sent3: The vertex of the cube was painted a different color.
meanings.sent4: The meeting point was the vertex of their collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The vertex of the hexagon had six sides meeting at one point.
